column4: Will the normal Ubuntu installation let me be able to do dual boot? Windows + Ubuntu
You mean that if I go through the normal installation
you get a menu when the machine start
ubuntu can resize an exisiting partition under install. but you can also use partition manager, or gparted.
please specify size after partition - put in 10000
Wouldn't that resize my C: to 10gb when it's 143gb now?
no, it would allocate 10 gb after the partition
let ubuntu partition the free space
it havent happened even once when ive installed ubuntu. And that is about 10 times on 4 different computers
of course, if you tell it to delete everything, it will
http://www.linuxlibrarian.org/node/319 - look at Prepare disk space
if you have some partitions on disk, but free space, it will come up with "use avaliable free space". Chose that, next, and ubuntu will do the rest
as i said, if you have unpartitioned space, ubuntu will give you an extra choice
if you do not have free space it will show something like this : http://www.cdprof.com/formation/linux/images/ubuntu-install.png - its french, but it allows you to resize one partition
